education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
responsibilities: Engineered a protocol-aware rule generator with LLMs to extract study logic from clinical trial protocols.
Converted unstructured protocol text into configurable validation checks, reducing manual review for experts.
Implemented a reviewer interface for editing and deploying suggested rules to ensure clinical transparency.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
responsibilities: Established a mature end-to-end local database using Room, enabling data storage and adaptive learning.
Designed production-grade inference APIs to integrate a food recognition model into retail-ready smart ovens.
Built a complete adaptive data pipeline supporting continuous model improvement within consumer homes.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
responsibilities: Developed computer vision algorithms to detect camera obstructions in KitchenAid ovens.
Deployed an internal support tool for rack-level detection, improving ML model performance.
Executed real-time testing on oven hardware, yielding 94% accuracy in validation tests.

projects.name: Rapid Ride
description: Utilized digital twin technology to test a virtual scooter program and assess environmental impacts.
Secured first place for best pitch and program at VinUniversity’s competition.
Created visualization results using interactive map-based data displays to show air and traffic improvements.

projects.name: Health Reflect
description: Implemented an intelligent mirror to monitor air quality within NYU Abu Dhabi.
Configured the system on a Raspberry Pi using low-level frameworks to process environmental data.
Integrated real-time data alerts for users when air quality levels became hazardous.

projects.name: ChessBot
description: Prototyped a functional smart chessboard controlled through voice command in 3 months.
Assembled a linear motion system with an electromagnet to move pieces automatically.
Used Google Cloud’s Speech-to-Text API to interpret commands and trigger piece movement.
Awarded the Gunter Georgi Award for Outstanding Engineering Innovation at NYU.

leadership.role: Global Leader & Scholar in STEM Honors Program
details: Recognized among 25 scholars for exemplary leadership and academic distinction.
Led cross-functional engineering projects addressing UN Sustainable Development Goals.
Participated in leadership training and career acceleration program.
Engaged with industry leaders to build skills in networking and personal branding.
